title: Now that Annie has a passive stun Indicator on her character bar
body: Can we add one for Yasuo's Q as well? Ittd help with clarity for the opponent and the Yasuo outside of particles and sound queues, which can be hard to really notice, especially on lower graphics settings and/or while listening to music.

replies.body:
I honestly don't see how you'd be unable to know when yasuo's third q is up unless you were playing on mute and with the visual effects set to minimum. And even then you can count to three pretty easy, he doesn't have that much time between q's to throw it out, definitely not long enough to lose track. If you're missing that many signs, you deserve to get hit by that q.

Annie could literally come back to lane and you wouldn't know if you were in stun danger or not.

Annie has visual effects on her as well beyond the 4 count on her life bar. If you are so good, you should have been able to notice it like you suggest.

Really, your argument against it isnt all that great. You need to keep track of the minion wave, yasuo, his Q counts, trying to figure out if he landed one or not, the minimap, etc. 

There are players who play on lower visual settings and without their volume on or are just listening to music instead. The animation around yasuo and annie are both easy to miss on lower visual settings.

Before the bar was added for Annie, the problem was when she was sitting on her third stack, then used her w and whatever ability she wanted to stun with. It completely bypassed the visual indicator, which is why she needed the new system. It's different than just a simple clarity issue. 

Also, since you keep mentioning it, there's an audio indicator for when Yas lands his q on something. Besides, you know...the health bar actually decreasing.

Again, many people dont play with audio, and might not notice a max range Q landing on a minion or something when youre focusing on kiting away, or if you dont have vision of him doing so (jungle monsters).

You make it sound like laning is some sort of high-action epic brawl when it's really way less intensive than that. Sure Yas wants to play aggro, but it's best just to stay back and farm. Keep it chill, and beware the swirly Yasuo.

Complain all you like, he ain't gettin' changed. All you're doing is trying to get some outside validation for a personal frustration. I hope it makes you feel better.
ITT: A Yas player doesn't want an idea to counterplay him shipped into the game.
Look, I hate yasuo as much as the next guy, I just don't think there needs to be even more clutter on his HP bar.

Or you know we just implement an auto sidestep because it is unfair to watch your cs, harass, minimap AND also sidestepping. 
And skillshots are far too hard to hit. 
Sorry i hate yasuo more than most of the players but all that just sounds as if you were actually too lazy to watch your opponent. 
I didn't even like the annie indicator as well and Zed indicator too. 
Same with jungle timers etc. 
This game is getting more and more casual and easier.

Theres a lot of little details going on in lane *and* in teamfights. Especially if youre just joining into the fight or gank and dont know how many Q stacks he is at, or if he is roaming and hit jungle mobs along the way with no vision.

You stated the annie change was because she could use it when you had no way of telling how many stacks she was at. I literally described scenarios where the same applies to yasuo.

Except

A. Sound indicator 
B. Very distinct visual indicator
C. Can click on him and see it
D. Goes away if unused, so the yasuo has to charge it in the fight.

A. Many people have music playing or sound off

B. Low graphics settings makes the "distinct visual indicator" much less noticable

C. Not really something youll do in a teamfight, or laning for that mater. Same could have been said for annie as well

D. He can charge it on jungle camps, and if youre the one ganking the lane you wont really be able to tell what stacks hes at.

It is within your control to have music playing.

Sometimes I like watching TV while I play. Why don't I just use a bot so I can watch TV while I'm playing?

I also play on low and I can still tell when he has it.

As someone else in this thread pointed out, deaf people can play league as well.

And i play on Low and its not all that easy to tell at all times, especially in a teamfight.
Then that's on you, as I can only play on low, and I can see it perfectly fine

" many people dont play with audio"

Thats your own fault then.

> Thats your own fault then.

There are also those who are deaf, aka cannot hear any audio, who play this game. It would be awesome to finally have visual indicators.
Theres pretty big swirly wind around Yasuo.
Blind people might not be able to see it though. Literally unplayable.
I don't have arms or legs and I'm blind, but if Riot won't let me use my mouth to type I'm suing them for emotional discomfort and sexual harassment. Completely unplayable and sexist.

You sound way to much like a yasuo player trying to make it so you don't get "nerfed" or in a much better word clarified the Annie issue wasn't really prevelant as you state. You act as if it's so hard to know how many stacks she had. Literally click on her it tells you under her hp mana bar thing in the top left. I'm not sure if it still does now that the bar is under her actual health bar but I'm positive it used to be. There's no reason why yasuo shouldn't have that changed about him and I overall believe it's a solid idea for a change.
Lol I don't play yasuo. I just don't see the need for it. It's needless clutter.
I am going to take the side that this is not necessary as well.  The visuals are pretty dramatic and in the lane you have PLENTY of time between q's to know exactly when it's coming.
The fact that graphics quality has an effect IS an issue. A huge issue in fact that calls for an indicator more than anything.

I actually don't know if the visual settings reduces the Q swirl or not, or in any meaningful way. I just wanted to say something probable instead of "unless you're blind," which would have sounded more of a jab than an actual argument.
Just tested it, Particles are nearly the same, not exactly as detailed but equally visible.
Doesn't mean there is no place for an improvement, especially the technology is already there.
You say improvement, I say needless clutter.
Bloodmoon yasuo conceals his 3rd q pretty well tbh..
Meh, why not? As I play a lot of Yasuo I don't really miss the particles or the sound, but anyone who doesn't could benefit from it.

Pretty much; even for a Yasuo player who might be listening to music or something and is concentrating on kiting and getting edge Qs off a visual thing under your HP bar would likely be beneficial in knowing if you got the hit or not and how close you are from your knockup.

And obviously for playing against him knowing how close he is to his knockup is kinda important, and its not always easy to count, especially if its at a distance where its hard to tell if he landed it or missed it.
There's also the matter of it falling off after not using Q for a while.

you can see his blade, it swirls with VERY visible wind

i'm not opposed to it, but most players wouldn't notice a difference laning against him
Low graphics settings makes it rather difficult to see the particles at times.
Idk I play on Lower graphics and I can see it perfectly fine, unless your blind.

Also it would add to much cluster for something that isn't really needed as theres already many queues for if its up and a big visual indicator. (That yes you can see on *Very low* settings, I play on that exclusively because potato computer)
Do you have fucking eyeballs?
{{champion:64}} Technically, yes.
Lee Sin does not have eyeballs, he melted them out of his skull by setting himself on fire because of a failed summoning which ended up killing a boy.
Lee set himself on fire in protest of Noxian occupation
Original lore was the summoner fail, but since the great retcon, things are either hastily done or kinda ignored on a lot of champion backstories.
Lore was that he failed the summon but that never caused a fire. His lore never changed.
Completely different though. Annie could Q on second stack, and E mid air to get the stun. With Yasuo, all he can do is Q.

The problem with Annie was that she could sit on 2 stacks and still stun you instantly, like by throwing a Q then shielding before the Q lands, or even just dropping 2 spells right on top of eachother. Yasuo can't do any of that.
Yasuo can get Q stacks off monsters/minions without you having vision of him, making you have no idea how close he is to his major spike going into the fight.
Pantheon could ise one for his passive as well imo

Idea: Take away Yasuo's shield and replace it with Q indicator.

Do not compensate.
You could also click him and see his Q counter, I do it all the time

You could have done that with annie, its just really obtuse and not useful. Things like Trynd ult and Yasuo Q stacks need a better on screen visual for the player and opponents to use than looking at buff bars, something you wont/shouldnt be looking at in a fight.

He can stack off of jungle monsters or out of vision, yes, but he cannot go from 1 stack to instant tornado, or to put it in another way he can't throw the tornado without the visual indicator ever being visible since there is a delay between his Q's at a minimum of 1.33 seconds, whereas Annie could throw abilities out so quickly you're stunned without ever having the opportunity to see the visual indicator regardless of graphics settings. She could be 1 stack less than needed for the visual indicator to appear and still stun you by shielding and then instantly using tibbers or some other spell. Yasuo cannot throw out a tornado until 1.33 seconds or more after the visual indicator and sound have happened **regardless** of the situation.
And? How does this make adding an annie-like bar on him for his Q a bad idea? How is added clarity bad?
